channel.title: ynet - News
channel.description: עדכוני SMS ישירות מחדר החדשות של ynet. שילחו את המילים ''התחל חדשות'' למספר 5335 וקבלו 4 עדכוני SMS ביום. השירות בתשלום.
channel.copyright: Ynet - news and content from Israel (Yedioth Ahronoth web site)

item.title: Netanyahu, Putin praise military cooperation in Paris
item.description: The two leaders spoke to succesful military cooperation, which has helped avert at least one aerial incident, while Russia began arming its bombers with air to air missiles for "defensive purposes."

item.title: Serious development reported in major Jewish terrorism case
item.description: Not much can be said regarding the major development in the recent case involving Jewish terrorism, but the evidence gathered was sufficient to issue a gag order over details of the case.

item.title: Netanyahu and Abbas shake hands for first time in five years
item.description: The Israeli PM and Palestinian President met face-to-face for the first time since 2010, at the 2015 United Nations Climate Change Conference in Paris.

item.title: The local legends fighting ISIS
item.description: Heroes to many in Syria and Iraq, three men – all belonging to different factions – have also become symbols. Meet Rambo, the Preacher, and the Tiger.

item.title: What happens to someone who killed a terrorist?
item.description: Over the last few weeks, hundreds of security forces, paramedics and civilians have responded to severe terror attacks. Some of them are likely to develop post-traumatic reactions. What do mental health officers do and how can these problems be tackled?

item.title: 'Muslims need to decide where they stand'
item.description: Waleed al-Husseini sat in Palestinian jail after daring to criticize radicals – but he says he is also under fire in France for his 'insensitive' ideas about Islam; Hamed Abdel-Samad is seen as radical because of his books; but both are unafraid of criticizing the religion in which they grew up, and they're not the only ones.

item.title: MK Elharar: Someone like Oren Hazan cannot be an MK
item.description: Karin Elharar doesn’t forgive Oren Hazan, and doesn’t plan on speaking to him again. In the first interview given since he mocked her for her disability, the MK tells us what Hazan said to her, calls for her fellow Knesset members to shun him, and explains that this insult is more than just personal.

item.title: AK-47 for 500 Euros: Running guns to the heart of Europe
item.description: Guns and assault rifles like those used in the Paris attacks, as well as attacks on a Jewish school in Toulouse, and the Jewish museum in Brussels, are not difficult to come by in Europe. Kalashnikovs from the former Yugoslavian arsenal are being sold by gunrunners for as little as $700, according to a Reuter's investigative report. .

item.title: 'Sweden a big supporter of Israel'
item.description: WATCH: Dr. Bjrn Brenner from the Swedish Defense University speaks to Ynetnews about official Swedish positions towards Israel and controversial remarks made by Foreign Minister Wallstrm last week.

item.title: PM approves marketing housing units beyond Green Line
item.description: Building of homes in Ramat Shlomo had been frozen, but Jerusalem municipality has demanded another 1,000 units.

item.title: IDF reservists have not received money owed to them after Gaza war
item.description: Following the operation in Gaza last summer, NIS 30 million were allocated for compensation to IDF reservists, but only NIS 13 million have been distributed.

item.title: Stadium evacuated over bomb threat
item.description: Germany-Netherlands soccer match in Hanover canceled after suspicious package found; police ask residents to return home and avoid public gatherings.

item.title: IDF troops come under fire near Ramallah
item.description: No Israelis wounded when three terrorists open fire next to Turmus Ayya in the West Bank; soldiers return fire, killing one attacker and arresting two.
